conclusion: In a uniform electric field, the horizontal component of the electron’s velocity (vx) is unchanged because the electric force acts vertically.

premise: The electron leaves the field making a 30° angle below the initial direction.
vx = v0 = 4.0 × 10^6 m s-1 and tan 30° = |vy| / vx

conclusion: Resultant speed at C: v = √(vx² + vy²) = v0 / cos 30° ≈ 4.62 × 10^6 m s-1
The mass of the electron is m = 9.1 × 10^-31 kg.
Kinetic energy at C: K = ½ m v² ≈ 9.7 × 10^-18 J
